title: Vahaamahina should be in front of a criminal court after crazy elbow that saved Wales from defeat
text:
Over the past two years, Wales have learned how to win ugly. We certainly saw that against France and I am sure next week will be no different against a South Africa side who play a similar way. That will be one hell of an arm wrestle.

I always knew the French side would come and play. The players I earmarked at the start of the tournament - Antoine Dupont, Damian Penaud and Virimi Vakatawa - all came to the fore and were magnificent at times. France missed opportunities, five points at goal, and Wales hung on in there.

The red card to Sebastian Vahaamahina, of course, changed everything. It was an act that belongs in a criminal court, let alone in front of a rugby judiciary. His elbow to the...
description: Over the past two years, Wales have learned how to win ugly.
